sentence.Network_en: I seem to fritter my time away at coffee mornings.
sentence.Network_cn: 我似乎把时间全都浪费在咖啡早茶会上了。

sentence.Network_en: Don't fritter away your precious time.
sentence.Network_cn: 大好时光,不可等闲度过.

sentence.Network_en: It's easy to fritter away a fortune if you're not careful.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果你不小心,要挥霍掉一大笔钱是很容易的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: based on obsolete fitter 'break into fragments, shred'; perhaps related to German Fetzen 'rag, scrap'
late Middle English: from Old French friture, based on Latin frigere (see fry). Compare with frittata

entry.def: Fritters are round pieces of fruit, vegetables, or meat that are dipped in batter and fried.
If someone fritters away time or money, they waste it on unimportant or unnecessary things.

example.ex: The firm soon started frittering away the cash it was generating...
example.tran: 这家公司不久就开始挥霍赚来的钱。

example.ex: I seem to fritter my time away at coffee mornings.
example.tran: 我似乎把时间全都浪费在咖啡早茶会上了。

means.word_mean: 1. small quantity of fried batter containing fruit or meat or vegetables

sentences.en: He’s frittered away the money his father left him.
sentences.cn: 他挥霍掉了父亲留给他的钱财。

sentences.en: She fritters away all her money on clothes and trips to the cinema.
sentences.cn: 她把所有的金钱都浪费在穿衣服和看电影上了。
